column4: anyone know how to create a symbolic link so firefox can use the jre java plugin?
you sure your problem isn't that you have icedtea
you sure your problem isn't that you have icedtea installed?
i just installed JDK and i guess JRE is included but i have to set a symbolic link so firefox knows where to look for the plugin?
ok, that isn't hard that either, but I have never needed symlinks for java.
from where to where you need to symlink?
i know how to create the link.....but i'm trying to do in in /home/*/.mozilla/plugins  and link that to ~/jdk*/jre/plugin/i386
/i386 has ns7 and ns7-gcc29.  I actually created the link to both and neither works....  do i have to do it in the firefox plugin folder?
but I can't understand why you would have to make the links yourself, I have never done that to use java plugins...
i have to manually do it cause i pulled the tar file from oracle instad of installing with apt-get
thanks for the help....  I'll gOoGlE some more
I might have found what you need, if you didn't already find it yourself.
i'm still looking....   what do you have?
unless it was intentional that you wanted it in your $HOME
actually it worked...the symbolic link still operates the same.  example:  ln -sfv /usr/local/jre1.6.0/plugin/i386/ns7/libjavaplugin_oji.so /home/corey/.mozilla/plugins
